result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper in court, in custody.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Adam Isaac Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present and would like contact lifted. State objects to return of cash. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Dade. Bond modified to allow phone contact between victim and defendant while defendant is in custody. Motion regarding cash bail denied. Minutes filed.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Petition to Alter Bail Bond
DA's request for certified copies

Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper in court, in custody by video.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Adam Isaac Cooper.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bond motion to be filed by 8-25-2022. Back to back trial dates set. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made.  Minutes filed.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:00 PM (64-06)Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney J J. Crawford in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney John Dade in court for and with Adam Isaac Cooper.

Not guilty plea entered by the court.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper in court, in custody by video.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Adam Isaac Cooper. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 10-27-22: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE PHONE CONTACT WITH VICITM WHILE IN CUSTODY.

BOND TO COVER 22CF407, 22CF237, 20CF324, & 20CF48

DEFENDANT MUST MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. NO DRIVING AT ALL. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH V.L. dob 7-10-1976, B.O. dob 6-4-1991, & L.H. dob 7-21-2008. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture. Bond set 4-19-2022

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper in court, in custody by video.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Adam Isaac Cooper. New bond set. Prior bond ordered forfeited. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:17 PM (64-06) Defendant Adam Isaac Cooper appeared by video.  Attorney John Robert Dade in court for Adam Isaac Cooper.  Attorney Samuel Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Shawn Reiff.
Shawn Reiff duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Berg. Witness identified the defendant in court on the video.
Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.  Exhibit # offered and received by the court. 
2:20PM - Cross examination by Attorney Dade.
Evidence is closed.
2:22PM - Argument by ADA Berg.
No argument by Attorney Dade.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Dade is requesting Arraignment date.
Arraignment scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
